title: Cant start client update. Just want to play
body:
I recently tried to install league again but I'm having a problem starting patching. 
Anytime I open the client it starts with the "Client Update Has Begun" screen. 
The problem is that the percent doesn't get above 0% before it has an error. "Unspecified error has occurred. Please check the logs for more information."

Ive reinstalled it a few times now and have no clue what to do.

replies.body:
That unspecified error is a pretty general catch all error when the client doesn't actually know what went wrong. I think I might know what happened though....

When the client starts patching, it first needs to scan the game files to see what is going to be changing. If your OS blocks League from scanning those files, it can throw this error. Follow the steps in this [**permission guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) and you should be able to get that patch going again, but definitely hit me back if not!
I tried everything in the permission guide and I still have the same problem.

We could go ahead and try a repair in the client options, since this could also be happening if it keeps running into corrupted files while scanning files for the update. Let's get you in touch with our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) first to make sure we get this fixed without wasting time on a repair.
Ill put in a ticket. But I've tried a repair. It scans about 15 files and then just goes back to trying to update the client.
Neither does anyone else that this is affecting.  Essentially you just have to hope for the best and try again later.  Literally the only fix I've found is to wait and try again every few hours.
